item.title: Binary Transformation
item.description: While procrastinating on the web - I learnt some cool, yet probably useless, stuff: how to turn any base 10 number into a binary, base2, number. It's surprisingly easy. Given any number x, one recursively divids x by 2 until one reaches 0. We deal only in integers. If division returns an even number the binary value is 0, if division returns an odd number the binary value is 1 (which is equal to the remainder of the division).
